User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; SunOS sun4u; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101205 Firefox/3.6.13
Build ID: 20101205235534

Steps to reproduce:

Solaris 10 on SPARC Sun V250 system.

I recently upgraded from Firefox version 3.6.23 to 7.0.1.  


Actual results:

In version 7.0.1, font rendering is extremely poor.  At various scales the fonts are displayed in the wrong color and vertical strokes of characters appear like an old color television with the RGB guns misaligned.  For example, when I visit the page:

http://www.forbes.com/sites/ericjackson/2011/10/28/why-siri-is-a-google-killer/

At the native font size the text appears to be blue and many of the vertical strokes have a red edge, making the text appear blurry.  If I scale the font size up, the font color changes to less blue and then to black, with the red lines disappearing.  If I scale the font size down, the text turns green and then eventually black!

When I fire up Firefox 3.6.23, I see none of these problems.


Expected results:

Fonts should render properly.

comments.raw_text:
What is your video adapter type?
And what is your monitor make and type?

It looks like your fonts rendering, smoothing, hinting, and subpixel order is incorrect.

On Solaris 10, you can run 'gnome-font-properties', choose a font rendering setting, and click details... to set smoothing, hinting, and subpixel order.
I think to use "Grayscale" for smoothing will get rid of blue or red edges.
Or you can use "None".

You may need to restart Firefox to apply the setting.

Let me know if it doesn't solve the problem.
It would be helpful if you can attach a screenshot.

Thanks!

comments.raw_text:
Ginn Chen:

Thanks you for your suggestion above.  I have dual XVR-100 graphic cards in this system, and changing the font rendering from "Subpixel smoothing (LCDs)" to "Best Contrast" (which sets Grayscale smoothing) did indeed make the misaligned colors, at what seems to be a bit softer rendering of the fonts.

I am attaching two GIFs.  The first (font1.gif) shows the original display problem (color lines as well as the text appearing blue), while the second (font2.gif) shows the same text when "Best contrast" is selected.

So now the question remains as to why I never saw this problem up through Firefox 3.6, but now see it with version 7?  There must be some change in the underlying font rendering algorithm.  I hope this helps.

Regards.

comments.raw_text:
I'm glad you can get around the problem with changing font rendering setting.

I didn't reproduce the problem on my Solaris 10 Update 9 on both SPARC and x86.
I tried various settings, but still didn't see the fonts rendering like your attachment.
Maybe my setting is different to yours, or newer fontconfig, pango or X library has fixed the problem.

For your question, why the problem is not in Firefox 3.6, the reason is the cairo library in Firefox 3.6 doesn't support full hinting.
